author: Rebecca Perring
title: Eurozone crisis - Netherlands vote for inquiry into ditching euro single currency | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
GETTY The inquiry is an attempt to wrestle power from Wilders 
But while this is likely to amount to ten more than his nearest rival, it falls a long way short of the 76-seats needed to form a majority government. 
The current Dutch prime minister mark Rutte has already rejected the possibility of forming a coalition government with Mr Wilders, saying there was “zero chance”. GETTY The Netherlands' elections take place next month 
But the 53-year-old politician remains convinced other parties will be forced to team up with the PVV if he can secure enough votes next month. 
Mr Wilders performance on March 15 will be the first test of whether the European political centre can hold firm against the rising tide of populism, in a year that will see Le Pen challenge the french Presidency and Angela Merkel vie for a fourth term despite her so-called failings over Germany’s open border policy.
